com.gej.graphics

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gej.graphics.Animation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Updateable

    public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
implements Updateable
    Contains a list of images and frame timing information to create an animation which is used by the GObject's.
    Author:
    Sri Harsha Chilakapati

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Animation()
      This default constructor could be used to create an empty animation object.
      Animation(java.awt.Image[] frames, int duration)
      This constructor is useful when you have same duration for every frame and could add frames from an image array.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFrame(java.awt.Image frame, int duration)
      Add an image as a frame of this animation with a specific duration.
      Animation clone()
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getBufferedImage()
      Gets you the current frame image of this animation object.
      java.awt.Image getImage()
      Gets you the current frame image of this animation object.
      boolean isPaused()
      Returns whether the animation is paused or not.
      void nextFrame()
      Skip this frame and move to the next one.
      void pause()
      Pause this animation
      void previousFrame()
      Displays the previous frame.
      void resume()
      Resume this animation
      void update(long elapsedTime)
      Updates the current animation object

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animation

        public Animation()
        This default constructor could be used to create an empty animation object. then use the addFrame() method to add sub-images with a specific delay.

      • Animation

        public Animation(java.awt.Image[] frames,
         int duration)
        This constructor is useful when you have same duration for every frame and could add frames from an image array.
        Parameters:
        frames - The image array containing all the frames
        duration - The common duration of each and every image.

    • Method Detail

      • addFrame

        public void addFrame(java.awt.Image frame,
            int duration)
        Add an image as a frame of this animation with a specific duration.
        Parameters:
        frame - The frame image
        duration - The duration

      • update

        public void update(long elapsedTime)
        Updates the current animation object
        Specified by:
        update in interface Updateable
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - The time spent in current frame

      • nextFrame

        public void nextFrame()
        Skip this frame and move to the next one. Note that all the frames are looped constantly.

      • previousFrame

        public void previousFrame()
        Displays the previous frame. Note that all the frames are looped constantly.

      • getImage

        public java.awt.Image getImage()
        Gets you the current frame image of this animation object.
        Returns:
        The current frame as an Image

      • getBufferedImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getBufferedImage()
        Gets you the current frame image of this animation object.
        Returns:
        The current frame as an Image

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause this animation

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resume this animation

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Returns whether the animation is paused or not.
        Returns:
        The paused state.

        public Animation clone()
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
